This is a known "Bug"

The issue is that when you dock one ship "the arm" to another ship. Which one of the command pods is now the actual "root part"?...

Thats the issue. Depending on where the new root part is you are likely trying to now control an IR component efectivly backwards some place. While you didn't actually build it backwards. After docking 2 ships together they become one big ship.

I was having a similar issue; the IR parts even appeared in the tech tree in already-researched nodes (career mode), but in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> those same parts wouldn't appear in search or under any part category. I uninstalled and did a fresh manual install, following the instructions on p93 exactly, this time including both legacy and rework parts (i.e. GameData\MagicSmokeIndustries\Parts contains the "Legacy" directory and three "Rework\_\*" directories).

The problem turned out to be a combination of 1. the part search function \*will not\* find any of the rework parts (!!!), 2. I only had the rework parts installed, and 3. I was using version 2.0.11 from <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> instead of 2.0.12, which fixes a bug adding a "Robotics" parts category containing all the IR parts.

The rework parts still don't appear in parts search, which is pretty mysterious and annoying... but they at least show up in the "Robotics" category.

Hello, I was wondering if it would be possible to make some type of custom independent suspension now using these IR parts. I noticed that in the part config of some parts, such as the extendatron, there are two settings: jointSpring and jointDamping. All I need is for these settings to be accessible through the part config menu in the editor (the menu that pops up when you right-click a part in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> or <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>). I am confused as to why these settings aren't accessible like that already.. was this a planned feature that just hasn't been fully implemented yet? But anyway, if possible, please allow us to change the jointSpring and jointDamping in-game on parts such as extendatron/foldatron/rotatron so we can make our own special suspension, that would be awesome ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

If you don't feel like implementing this feature yourself, please tell me (if possible) how I could do this myself if its not too difficult.

Another thing that might work good for suspension for example is an IR foldable hydraulic leg with an attachment point on the foot.
